alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 4:54AM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Klamath Basin and Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes Highway 97, 140 and 31 as well as Klamath Falls, Chemult, Bly and surrounding communities. For the Winter Storm Watch, Highway 97 Modoc Point to Gilchrist. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
